Package de.elo.ix.client.webapp

Interface AppConnManager

public interface AppConnManager
This interface helps to create Indexserver connections.

  • Nested Class Summary

    Nested Classes 
    Modifier and Type Interface Description
    static interface  AppConnManager.UniqueConnectionInitialized
    This interface defines a callback function that is called from the AppConnManager, if the function initUniqueConnection has established a connection.

  • Method Summary

    Modifier and Type Method Description
    IXConnection createConnection​(java.lang.String runAs)
    Creates a connection to the Indexserver.
    IXConnection createConnection​(java.lang.String computerName, java.lang.String runAs)
    Creates a connection to the Indexserver.
    IXConnection createConnection​(java.lang.String ixUrl, java.lang.String userName, java.lang.String userPwd, java.lang.String computerName, java.lang.String runAs)
    Creates a connection to the Indexserver.
    Application getApplication()
    Back pointer to the Application object that contains this ConnManager.
    IXConnFactory getConnFactory()
    Returns an IXConnFactory object initialized with the Indexserver URL found in the configuration properties.
    IXConnFactory getConnFactory​(java.lang.String ixUrl)
    Returns an IXConnFactory object initialized with the supplied connection parameters.
    java.util.List<AppEvent> getEvents()
    Get the list of events.
    IXConnection getUniqueConnection()
    Gets the unique internally stored Indexserver connection.
    void initUniqueConnection()
    Initialize the unique internally stored Indexserver connection.
    void shutdown()  

  • Method Details

    • getApplication

      Application getApplication()
      Back pointer to the Application object that contains this ConnManager.
      Returns:
      Object

    • getConnFactory

      IXConnFactory getConnFactory​(java.lang.String ixUrl) throws byps.RemoteException
      Returns an IXConnFactory object initialized with the supplied connection parameters.
      Parameters:
      ixUrl - Indexserver URL
      Returns:
      IXConnFactory object.
      Throws:
      byps.RemoteException
      See Also:
      getConnFactory()

    • getConnFactory

      IXConnFactory getConnFactory() throws byps.RemoteException
      Returns an IXConnFactory object initialized with the Indexserver URL found in the configuration properties. The function assumes, that the Indexserver URL can be found under the key getApplication().getAppPropertyNames().getIxUrl().
      Returns:
      IXConnFactory object
      Throws:
      byps.RemoteException
      See Also:
      getConnFactory(String), AppConfig.getAppPropertyNames()

    • createConnection

      IXConnection createConnection​(java.lang.String ixUrl, java.lang.String userName, java.lang.String userPwd, java.lang.String computerName, java.lang.String runAs) throws byps.RemoteException
      Creates a connection to the Indexserver.
      Parameters:
      ixUrl - Indexserver URL
      userName - User name
      userPwd - User password
      computerName - Computer name (internally prefixed by the program name)
      runAs - Run-As user
      Returns:
      IXConnection
      Throws:
      byps.RemoteException

    • createConnection

      IXConnection createConnection​(java.lang.String computerName, java.lang.String runAs) throws byps.RemoteException
      Creates a connection to the Indexserver. The Indexserver URL, the user name and password are taken from the configuration properties.
      Parameters:
      computerName - Computer name (internally prefixed by the program name)
      runAs - Run-As user
      Returns:
      IXConnection
      Throws:
      byps.RemoteException
      See Also:
      AppConfig.getAppPropertyNames()

    • createConnection

      IXConnection createConnection​(java.lang.String runAs) throws byps.RemoteException
      Creates a connection to the Indexserver. The Indexserver URL, the user name and password are taken from the configuration properties. The computer name is queried by java runtime functions.
      Parameters:
      runAs - Run-As user
      Returns:
      IXConnection
      Throws:
      byps.RemoteException
      See Also:
      AppConfig.getAppPropertyNames()

    • getUniqueConnection

      IXConnection getUniqueConnection() throws byps.RemoteException, java.lang.InterruptedException
      Gets the unique internally stored Indexserver connection. Call this function, if the application does only need one connection to the Indexserver. (The IXConnection class is thread-save). This method should not be invoked in a Servlet.init method.
      Returns:
      IXConnection object
      Throws:
      byps.RemoteException - thrown on timeout
      java.lang.InterruptedException
      See Also:
      initUniqueConnection()

    • initUniqueConnection

      void initUniqueConnection()
      Initialize the unique internally stored Indexserver connection. Call this function, if the application does only need one connection to the Indexserver. (The IXConnection class is thread-save). The Indexserver URL, the user name and password are taken from the configuration properties. This method should be invoked in a Servlet.init method. It initializes the connection in a background thread and returns immediately.
      Throws:
      byps.RemoteException
      See Also:
      AppConnManager.UniqueConnectionInitialized.process(Object[] args), getEvents()

    • getEvents

      java.util.List<AppEvent> getEvents()
      Get the list of events. In order to listen for events, add an object that implements the event interfaces.
      Returns:
      List

    • shutdown

      void shutdown()
